intro: Spinacia tetrandra f. laevis, commonly known as the smooth-leafed spinach, is a cultivated form of the common spinach plant. It is characterized by its smooth, broad leaves that are typically harvested before they become too large. This variety is valued for its mild flavor and high nutritional content, including vitamins A and C. The plant thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. It is often grown as a leafy green vegetable in home gardens and commercial farms.
